did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: University of Arizona Office of the President records, 1937-1947
did.abstract: Correspondence and financial papers relating to the administration and management of the university including areas such as building and grounds, military matters, student health, land acquisitions, enrollment statistics, student publications, fraternities and sororities, scholarships and awards, WPA Federal Works Agency proposed projects, and other issues.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: University of Arizona. Office of the President

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the user to obtain permission to publish from the owner of the copyright (the institution, the creator of the record, the author or his/her transferees, heirs, legates, or literary executors). The user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Arizona Board of Regents for the University of Arizona, its officers, employees, and agents from and against all claims made by any person asserting that he or she is an owner of copyright.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: University of Arizona Office of the President records(AZ 426). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and financial papers relating to the administration and management of the university including areas such as building and grounds, military matters, student health, land acquisitions, enrollment statistics, student publications, fraternities and sororities, scholarships and awards, WPA Federal Works Agency proposed projects, and other issues. Also includes material concerning World War II including Naval Training School, 1941-1946, the selective service system, and internment of Japanese Americans. Correspondents include U.S. Senators Henry F. Ashurst and Carl Hayden, and U.S. Representative John R. Murdock, Governors R.C. Stanford, Robert T. Jones, and Sidney P. Osborn, and various members of the Board of Regents, faculty and students.

item.corpname: University of Arizona -- Records and correspondence

item.subject: World War, 1939-1945 -- United States -- Education and the war

relatedmaterial.p: Additional Atkinson papers at AZ 294; additional President's papers at AZ 76, AZ 406, AZ 420, AZ 427.

scopecontent.p: Folders 8-10 include an evaluation of the Art Department by Gerry Peirce, April 1938; proposal for a music festival, 1938-1939; repairs in Herring Hall for use of Drama Department, 1940; accomodations for Marian Anderson at President's House, October 1941; possible acquisition of a painting of an Indian scene in the Yuma U.S. O. Office, created by Italian prisoner of war, 1945-1946.
